isis.stitle: INTERNATIONAL® VT 365 DIESEL ENGINE - ELECTRONICALLY CONTROLLED VARIABLE GEOMETRY TURBOCHARGER (VGT) - Operation - Removal

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.
To prevent personal injury or death, shift transmission to park or neutral, set parking brake, and block wheels before doing diagnostic or service procedures.
To prevent personal injury or death, make sure engine has cooled before removing components.
To prevent personal injury or possible death, disconnect the main battery negative terminal before disconnecting or connecting electrical components.

To prevent personal injury or death, do not let engine fluids stay on your skin. Clean skin and nails using hand cleaner and wash with soap and water. Wash or discard clothing and rags contaminated with engine fluids.

note.para: Engine fluids (oil, fuel, and coolant) are a threat to the environment. Recycle or dispose of engine fluids according to local regulations. Never put engine fluids in the trash, on the ground, in sewers or bodies of water.

figure.caption: Figure 35. Rotation of air inlet duct and breather hose assembly with pitot tube

calloutgroup.callout1: Breather hose assembly with pitot tube

step1.para: Remove the turbocharger air inlet ducting as follows:

step2.para: Loosen the air inlet duct clamp.
Remove oil fill extension tube and place a cap in the oil fill hole of the valve cover to prevent foreign material from entering.
Remove air inlet duct by turning breather hose and pitot tube approximately 90° from the valve cover as shown.

step1.para: Remove the two M8 x 20 bolts from the oil supply tube on the top of turbocharger assembly. Swing the oil supply tube out of the way.
Remove the oil supply tube gasket and discard.

figure.caption: Figure 37. Removal of turbocharger oil supply tube

step1.para: Using the #8 Quick Release Tool , carefully insert the tool under the free floating washer until the oil supply tube releases.
Disconnect the VGT control valve harness electrical connection.
Remove the turbocharger exhaust adapter V-clamp.

figure.caption: Figure 39. Turbocharger rear mounting bolts and spacers

step1.para: Remove two M8 x 30 flange head bolts and spacers securing the turbocharger to the rear of its mounting bracket.

figure.caption: Figure 40. Turbocharger front mounting bolt and spacer

step1.para: Remove one M8 x 30 flange head bolt and spacer securing the turbocharger to the front of its mounting bracket.

note.para: If removing the turbocharger only, cap off oil drain to prevent foreign material from entering engine.

step1.para: Lift the turbocharger assembly up and off the engine. Cap all openings on turbocharger assembly.

note.para: Use Compressor Inlet Cap and Exhaust Outlet Cap . If plastic caps are not available, use tape to cover openings.

figure.caption: Figure 41. Removing turbocharger oil drain tube

step1.para: Remove turbocharger oil drain tube by pulling it out of the hydraulic pump cover.
Remove four M8 x 20 turbocharger bracket bolts.
Lift up left side of the bracket first,so the right side can clear the EGR cooler coolant inlet tube.
